original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i mchog sbyin pa gzhan la ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i mchog sbyin pa gzhan la ma yin no //
translated: not from another, such as Īśvara, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is taught by this [verse].

original: aom tsi tta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
analyzed: aom tsi tta pra ti be dham ka ro mi /
translated: [The verse] “Oṃ, I will perform the consecration of the mind”

original: zhes bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du brjod cing sems so sor rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du brjod cing sems so sor rtogs par bya'o //
translated: is recited just as it is, and the mind is consecrated.

original: de nas aom bo dhi tsi ttam au tp'a da ya mi /
analyzed: de nas aom bo dhi tsi ttam au tp'a da ya mi /
translated: Then, with “Oṃ, I generate the enlightenment mind”

original: zhes bya bas byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bya'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya bas byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bya'o ;
translated: the enlightenment mind is generated.🔽Then, with “Oṃ, be firm, vajra” and “Vajra ātmāka, ham”

original: de nas aom ti shtha badzra zhes bya bas rdo rje dang / badzra a'a tma ko & ham zhes bya bas rdo rje'i bdag nyid du bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas aom ti shtha badzra zhes bya bas rdo rje dang / badzra a'a tma ko & ham zhes bya bas rdo rje'i bdag nyid du bskyed par bya'o //
translated: the vajra and the vajra nature are generated.

original: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ham zhes bya ba brjod cing rnal 'byor ba bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad du bsgom par byas na /
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ham zhes bya ba brjod cing rnal 'byor ba bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad du bsgom par byas na /
translated: If the yogin recites “Oṃ, I am all the tathāgatas” and meditates on himself as Vairocana,

original: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: he becomes a tathāgata.

original: de ltar mngon par byang chub pa 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par byang chub pa 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the tantra of the knowledge of the arising of manifest enlightenment,🔽now, in order to teach the tantra of the knowledge of the arising of the great maṇḍala, he says “the great maṇḍala” and so forth.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdud nyid du shes nas rnal 'byor ba bgegs med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdud nyid du shes nas rnal 'byor ba bgegs med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the yogin becomes free from obstacles by knowing the demon to be the Tathagata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bdud nyid du shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bdud nyid du shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares the Tantra of Knowing the Demon to be the Tathagata.

original: rang gi sems nyid du bdud nyid de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid du bdud nyid de zhes bya ba la /
translated: The demon is one's own mind.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i bdud du rnam par rtog pa can gyi sems nyid bdud de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i bdud du rnam par rtog pa can gyi sems nyid bdud de /
translated: The demon of the yogin is the mind that has the aspect of conceptualization.

original: de'i dngos po ni bdud nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bdud nyid do //
translated: The entity of that is the demon.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word ni means for what reason.

original: gang gi phyir bdud kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnal 'byor ba'i rang gi sems kho na bdud de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdud kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnal 'byor ba'i rang gi sems kho na bdud de /
translated: For what reason is the yogin's own mind, which has the aspect of the demon, the demon?

original: phyi rol gyi lha'i bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdud ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lha'i bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi bdud ni ma yin pas /
translated: The demon, which has the nature of an external son of a god, etc., is not.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor bas bdud kyi rnam pa can gyi sems chos bdag med pa'i bsgom pas mi snang bar byas la 'jigs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor bas bdud kyi rnam pa can gyi sems chos bdag med pa'i bsgom pas mi snang bar byas la 'jigs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogin should eliminate fear by making the mind that has the aspect of the demon invisible by meditating on the selflessness of phenomena.

original: chos bdag med pa'i sgo nas ji ltar rnal @181b 'byor pas 'jigs pa 'di spang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i sgo nas ji ltar rnal @181b 'byor pas 'jigs pa 'di spang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: How should the yogi/nī abandon this fear by way of the objective selflessness?

original: sems nyid de bzhin gshegs pa yin //
analyzed: sems nyid de bzhin gshegs pa yin //
translated: The mind itself is the Tathāgata.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa bral ba'i sems de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa bral ba'i sems de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: the mind itself, free from the apprehended and apprehender, is the Tathāgata, which is the realization.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: It is the nature of the realization of all phenomena as the nature of non-entityness.

original: de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi dbye ba med pa bsgom pa 'dis bdud kyi 'jigs pa spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi dbye ba med pa bsgom pa 'dis bdud kyi 'jigs pa spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, by this meditation that is without the differentiation of self and other, the fear of Māra should be abandoned.

original: rang bzhin gyi sems ni 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sems ni 'dul bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to discipline the mind itself,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir rang gi sems la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir rang gi sems la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is so, in order to stop the conceptualization of the apprehended and apprehender in one’s own mind,

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: the Buddha is the Tathāgata.

original: de'i dngos po ni bdud nyid du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bdud nyid du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: His entity is the very thing that goes to Māra.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi sems gyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsod pa na bdud do //
analyzed: rang gi sems gyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsod pa na bdud do //
translated: When one’s own mind kills the conceptualization of object and subject, that is Māra.

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste de'i dngos po ni bdud nyid do /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste de'i dngos po ni bdud nyid do /
translated: Buddha is the Tathāgata, and his nature is Māra.

original: bdud nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo yong na par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin du gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo yong na par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin du gshegs pa yin no //
translated: That very Māra is the Tathāgata, who has gone to the nature of enlightenment.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bdud nyid kyi rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bdud nyid kyi rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the continuum of the Tathāgata as Māra,

original: da ni rtog pa thams cad kyi sgrub pa shes pas yid bzhin nor bu dang / bum pa bzang po dang / dpag bsam gyi shing dang / ral gri dang / mig sman dang / 'bar ba'i ras dang / rkang mgyogs dang / ri lu la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rtog pa thams cad kyi sgrub pa shes pas yid bzhin nor bu dang / bum pa bzang po dang / dpag bsam gyi shing dang / ral gri dang / mig sman dang / 'bar ba'i ras dang / rkang mgyogs dang / ri lu la sogs pa'i dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that by knowing the accomplishment of all concepts, one attains the accomplishments of the wish-fulfilling gem, the excellent vase, the wish-fulfilling tree, the sword, the eye medicine, the blazing cloth, the swift-footedness, the pill, and so forth,

original: de nas rtog pa thams cad sgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas rtog pa thams cad sgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then the tantra called the Knowledge of the Accomplishment of All Concepts is taught.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje khro bo dang / rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po dang / phyi'i rdo rje'i rigs kyi rtog pa rnams ni rtog pa kun te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje khro bo dang / rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po dang / phyi'i rdo rje'i rigs kyi rtog pa rnams ni rtog pa kun te /
translated: The Vajrasattva, Tathagata, and the Vajra-Heruka of the Joyous, the Vajra-Lokeśvara, the Noble Ākāśagarbha, and the external Vajra-family Tantra-sets are all the Tantra-sets.

original: rtog pa kun de rnams su yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / bum pa bzang po la sogs pa bstan pa bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa dang / yang na khye'u dang bu mo la sogs pa sems dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin can gyi g-yo ba bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de ni brtan @182a * //
analyzed: rtog pa kun de rnams su yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / bum pa bzang po la sogs pa bstan pa bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa dang / yang na khye'u dang bu mo la sogs pa sems dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin can gyi g-yo ba bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de ni brtan @182a * //
translated: All those Tantra-sets teach the wish-fulfilling gem, the excellent vase, etc., which are the things to be accomplished, or else the things to be accomplished are the movements of the nature of the mind, such as the boy and girl, etc.

original: pa dang g-yo ba ste /🔽bsgrub par bya ba de dag thams cad rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor ni /
analyzed: pa dang g-yo ba ste / bsgrub par bya ba de dag thams cad rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor ni /
translated: Those are the things to be accomplished, which are both the stable and the moving.

original: 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor te des bsgrub par byas na de dag 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor te des bsgrub par byas na de dag 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yoga of one’s own special deity is the yoga of the desired deity, and by that one accomplishes all those things to be accomplished.

original: de ltar rtog pa thams cad sgrub pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa thams cad sgrub pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the tantra of the accomplishment of all contemplations,

original: da ni dang po'i snying po sgrub pa shes nas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dang po'i snying po sgrub pa shes nas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that having known the accomplishment of the essence of the first, one will attain the spiritual power of glorious Vajrasattva,

original: de nas dang po'i snying po sgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas dang po'i snying po sgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares the tantra called the knowledge of the accomplishment of the essence of the first.

original: dang po yang yin la snying po yang de nyid yin pas na dang po'i snying po ste /
analyzed: dang po yang yin la snying po yang de nyid yin pas na dang po'i snying po ste /
translated: Since it is the first and it is the essence, it is the essence of the first.

original: aom ma h'a su kha badzra sa tva dza: h'um bam ho: su ra ta stvam zhes bya ba'i yi ge bcu bdun gang bstan pa de sgrub pa'i phyir shes pa ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: aom ma h'a su kha badzra sa tva dza: h'um bam ho: su ra ta stvam zhes bya ba'i yi ge bcu bdun gang bstan pa de sgrub pa'i phyir shes pa ni nges pa ste /
translated: The seventeen syllables of the mantra, Oṃ mahāsukha vajrasattva jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ su-rata stvaṃ, are taught.

original: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The tantra that teaches that was spoken by the Blessed One, Vajrasattva.

original: bzlas pa'i don shes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzlas pa'i don shes zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the recitation is known.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor byas nas /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor byas nas /
translated: Having performed the yoga of glorious Vajrasattva,

original: ye ge bcu bdun po'i snying po rang gi snying ga na gnas pa'i rdo rje'i dbus su yid kyis mngon par bris la /
analyzed: ye ge bcu bdun po'i snying po rang gi snying ga na gnas pa'i rdo rje'i dbus su yid kyis mngon par bris la /
translated: Having mentally inscribed in the center of the vajra located in one's heart the essence of the seventeen syllables,

original: rab tu dga' ba'i ngag gam /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i ngag gam /
translated: one should recite with the voice of supreme joy,

original: rdo rje'i dag gis brjod cing dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid can du bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dag gis brjod cing dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid can du bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
translated: or with the vajra recitation, and contemplate oneself as having the nature of the body, speech, and mind of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: 'di ni bzlas pa'i don shes par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bzlas pa'i don shes par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is said to be the knowledge of the meaning of recitation.

original: bzlas pa'i don shes pa nges nus pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽ji ltar bdag nyid nus pa'i stobs kyis rdo rje sems dpar rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i don shes pa nges nus pa zhes bya ba ni / ji ltar bdag nyid nus pa'i stobs kyis rdo rje sems dpar rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the meaning of recitation is called the ability to ascertain.

original: ji srid 'dod pas bzlas pa mchog ;
analyzed: ji srid 'dod pas bzlas pa mchog ;
translated: One should accomplish oneself as Vajrasattva by the power of one's ability, for as long as one desires.

original: / ces bya ba la bsgom pa kho na la 'dir 'bad par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: / ces bya ba la bsgom pa kho na la 'dir 'bad par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The supreme recitation is taught here as the effort in meditation alone,

original: grangs kyi bzlas pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: grangs kyi bzlas pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: not in the recitation of a certain number of repetitions.

original: dngos grub chen po'i bde ba ster //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos grub chen po'i bde ba ster //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: It bestows the bliss of the great attainment.

original: snying po de dpag tu med pa bzlas pas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po'i bde ba ster ba yin no //
analyzed: snying po de dpag tu med pa bzlas pas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po'i bde ba ster ba yin no //
translated: By reciting that essence mantra an unlimited number of times, one will obtain the great bliss of the great powers of the great seal of glorious Vajrasattva, and so forth.

original: de ltar dang po'i snying po'i sgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /🔽da ni snying po dang phyag rgya dang sngags dang rig pa rnams kyi shes pas snying po dang phyag rgya dang sngags dang rig pa rnams kyi @182b dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dang po'i snying po'i sgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas / da ni snying po dang phyag rgya dang sngags dang rig pa rnams kyi shes pas snying po dang phyag rgya dang sngags dang rig pa rnams kyi @182b dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the tantra that knows the accomplishment of the essence mantra,🔽now, in order to teach that by knowing the essence mantra, the great seal, the knowledge-mantra, and the action seal, one will obtain the powers of the essence mantra, the great seal, the knowledge-mantra, and the action seal,

original: de nas snying po dang phyag rgya dang sngags dang rig pa bsgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas snying po dang phyag rgya dang sngags dang rig pa bsgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he said, “Now, the tantra that knows the accomplishment of the essence mantra, the great seal, the knowledge-mantra, and the action seal.”

original: de la snying po ni 'dir phyag rgya chen po'i phyag rgya ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //🔽sngags ni chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de la snying po ni 'dir phyag rgya chen po'i phyag rgya ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o // sngags ni chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Therein, the essence mantra is the pledge seal of the great seal.🔽The knowledge-mantra is the doctrine seal.

original: rig pa ni las kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni las kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The action seal is the action seal.

original: rgyud gzhan nas gsungs pa'i snying po dang phyag rgya la sogs pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan nas gsungs pa'i snying po dang phyag rgya la sogs pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand the essence, seal, and so forth taught in other tantras in the same way,

original: sems dpa' gang gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dpa' gang gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is said, “By whatever hero,”🔽and so forth.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ji ltar bshad pa'i snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / sngags dang / rig pa rnams bzlas pa'i don du bdag nyid dam mdun du bsgrub par byas na /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ji ltar bshad pa'i snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / sngags dang / rig pa rnams bzlas pa'i don du bdag nyid dam mdun du bsgrub par byas na /
translated: If one accomplishes oneself or in front [of oneself] the essence, seal, mantra, and knowledge taught as the essence, seal, mantra, and knowledge of Vajrasattva, and so forth, for the purpose of recitation,

original: de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: it will be accomplished in that way.

original: da ni dngos grub shes pas rigs lnga las gsungs pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos grub shes pas rigs lnga las gsungs pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that by knowing the powers one will attain the powers taught in the five families,

original: de nas dngos grub shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas dngos grub shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Then, the tantra called the knowledge of powers.”

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i nyang dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rdo rje 'chang nyid dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid dang / 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po nyid rdzogs shing nges par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni dngos grub shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i nyang dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid dang / rdo rje 'chang nyid dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug nyid dang / 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po nyid rdzogs shing nges par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni dngos grub shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the powers is that which is accomplished and ascertained as the perfection of Vajrasattva, Tathagata, Vajradhara, Lokeśvara, and Ārya Ākāśagarbha.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub che //
translated: The great power of Vajrasattva.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid rtog pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid rtog pa ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dngos grub chen po'o //
translated: the great power of Vajrasattva is the imagination of Vajrasattva himself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la kun kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la kun kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun te /
translated: Since he is the Tathagata and all are also, he is all the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi dngos grub gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dngos grub gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi'o //
translated: The power of those is the power of all the Tathagatas.

original: rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rigs te de'i dngos po ni rdo rje nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rigs te de'i dngos po ni rdo rje nyid do //
translated: Vajra is the vajra family, and its nature is vajra-ness.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' ste padma'i rigs so ;
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' ste padma'i rigs so ;
translated: The being whose nature is enlightenment is a bodhisattva, which is the lotus family.

original: / de'i dngos po ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
analyzed: / de'i dngos po ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
translated: The thing is the state of a bodhisattva.

original: las kyang yin la kun yang yin pas kun te rin po che'i rigs rnams so //
analyzed: las kyang yin la kun yang yin pas kun te rin po che'i rigs rnams so //
translated: And since it is an action and also all, it is all, that is, the jewel families.

original: 'di rnams kyi mchog gi dngos grub ni rigs thams cad rtogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi mchog gi dngos grub ni rigs thams cad rtogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The supreme attainment of these is the nature of the realization of all families.

original: de dag gi mchog gi dngos grub @183a * //
analyzed: de dag gi mchog gi dngos grub @183a * //
translated: The supreme attainment of these is this.

original: ni 'di rnams yin no zhes bya bar nges pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: ni 'di rnams yin no zhes bya bar nges pa bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated certainty in that,

original: de rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa byas nas rnal 'byor grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa byas nas rnal 'byor grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: having cultivated meditation in order to attain them, one will achieve yoga.

original: de ltar dngos grub shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /🔽da ni bsod nams med pa'i dngos grub shes pas bsod nams med pa rnams med kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dngos grub shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas / da ni bsod nams med pa'i dngos grub shes pas bsod nams med pa rnams med kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the tantra that knows attainment,🔽now, in order to teach that those who lack merit will also succeed even without merit, by the knowledge of the attainment of those who lack merit,

original: de nas bsod nams med pa rnams kyi yang dngos grub shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bsod nams med pa rnams kyi yang dngos grub shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares, “Now, the tantra that knows the attainment of those who lack merit.”

original: ci 'dod 'khor lor bris nas ni //
analyzed: ci 'dod 'khor lor bris nas ni //
translated: Having written whatever is desired on a wheel,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i bsnyen pa sngon du byas pas kyang rnal 'byor ba la sgrib pa yod pas mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub grub par ma gyur na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i bsnyen pa sngon du byas pas kyang rnal 'byor ba la sgrib pa yod pas mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub grub par ma gyur na /
translated: In this way, even though one has previously performed the approximation as explained, if the practitioner does not achieve the desired power due to the presence of obscurations,

original: de'i tshe rang gi rigs kyi lha'i dkyil 'khor mtha' mar thal pas kyang bris pa la 'jug pa'i cho gas zhugs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi rigs kyi lha'i dkyil 'khor mtha' mar thal pas kyang bris pa la 'jug pa'i cho gas zhugs te /
translated: then at that time, one should enter the maṇḍala of one’s own family deity, even if it is drawn on the ground, by the rite of entry.

original: zhag bzhir phyag rgya chen po bcings nas dkyil 'khor bsgom par byas na /
analyzed: zhag bzhir phyag rgya chen po bcings nas dkyil 'khor bsgom par byas na /
translated: Having meditated on the maṇḍala for four days, binding the great seal,

original: de sgrib pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sgrib pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all obscurations will be removed.

original: de ltar bsod nams med pa rnams kyi yang sgrub pa shes pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams med pa rnams kyi yang sgrub pa shes pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the knowledge of the practice even for those who lack merit,

original: da ni slob dpon gyi dngos grub shes pas kyang dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyi dngos grub shes pas kyang dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that one will also attain power through the knowledge of the master’s power,

original: de nas slob dpon nyid kyi dngos grub shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon nyid kyi dngos grub shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the Tantra of the Knowledge of the Master’s Power is stated.

original: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje chen po ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The great vajra of great bliss is Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: de dag gi gsang ba mchog gi dam tshig ni dkyil 'khor chen po la sogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de dag gi gsang ba mchog gi dam tshig ni dkyil 'khor chen po la sogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Their supreme secret pledge is the mandala of all the clans, such as the great mandala and so forth.

original: der ji skad bshad pa'i 'jug pa'i tshogs zhugs te /
analyzed: der ji skad bshad pa'i 'jug pa'i tshogs zhugs te /
translated: Having entered that mandala as explained,

original: sngar bshad pa'i chogs bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i chogs bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: one should confer initiation upon oneself with the previously explained ritual.

original: de ltar na slob dpon nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na slob dpon nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, one becomes a master.

original: da ni me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa 'bul ba shes pas me tog la sogs pa phul bas tshogs yongs su rdzogs nas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa 'bul ba shes pa'i rgyud
analyzed: da ni me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa 'bul ba shes pas me tog la sogs pa phul bas tshogs yongs su rdzogs nas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa 'bul ba shes pa'i rgyud
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that one should offer flowers and so forth, and that by offering flowers and so forth, having completed the accumulations, one will attain power, the Tantra of the Knowledge of Offering Flowers and so forth

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is stated.

original: rdo rje @183b 'dzin la mchod pa kun //
analyzed: rdo rje @183b 'dzin la mchod pa kun //
translated: All offerings to the vajra holder

original: zhes bya ba la sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'i kha dog can gyi me tog la sogs pa rnams ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs la dbul par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'i kha dog can gyi me tog la sogs pa rnams ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs la dbul par bya'o //
translated: Here, flowers having the colors blue, yellow, red, and white should be offered to the Vajrasattva family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la ni kha dog dkar po can no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la ni kha dog dkar po can no //
translated: To the Tathagata family, those having the color white.

original: rdo rje'i bdag nyid can gyi rigs la ni kha dog nag po can no //🔽padma'i rigs la ni kha dog dmar po can no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i bdag nyid can gyi rigs la ni kha dog nag po can no // padma'i rigs la ni kha dog dmar po can no //
translated: To the Vajra family, those having the color black.🔽To the Padma family, those having the color red.

original: nor bu'i rigs la ni kha dog ser bo can no //🔽'di rnams kyang dpyid ka'i rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya rnams kyis blangs te dbul bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nor bu'i rigs la ni kha dog ser bo can no // 'di rnams kyang dpyid ka'i rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya rnams kyis blangs te dbul bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To the Mani family, those having the color yellow.

original: de nas 'bul ba shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas 'bul ba shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that these should be offered with the offering mudras of Vasanta-vajra, etc., the Tantra called The Tantra of the Knowledge of Offering is taught.

original: rdzogs pa'am zhes bya ba ni dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya phyi rol gyi me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'am zhes bya ba ni dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya phyi rol gyi me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The word complete means the offering goddesses such as Vasanta-vajri, together with the external offerings of flowers, etc.

original: de dang bral ba ni ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni ma tshang ba'o //
translated: The word without means incomplete.

original: yang na ji ltar rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, as much as one can get means

original: phyogs gcig tsam thob pa ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tsam thob pa ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: the generation of just a part of the mandala.🔽 The word offering means

original: rdo rje gar ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa yis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje gar ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa yis zhes bya ba la /
translated: the offering goddesses such as Vajra-nartaki, etc.

original: rdo rje gar ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rdo rje gar ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The word dance has already been explained.

original: de nyid dang po gang dag la yod pa de ni rdo rje gar ma la sogs ba'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang po gang dag la yod pa de ni rdo rje gar ma la sogs ba'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The word offering means the offering goddesses such as Vajra-nartaki, etc.

original: dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya rnams so //
analyzed: dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya rnams so //
translated: The word offering means the offering goddesses such as Vasanta-vajri, etc.

original: de dag gis rtag tu ste rtag pa kho nar phyogs bcu thams cad kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis rtag tu ste rtag pa kho nar phyogs bcu thams cad kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By those offerings, one always, that is, constantly, accomplishes the offering of flowers, etc., to the mandalas of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas in the ten directions.

original: da ni dus kyi mchod pa bsgrub par shes pas kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni dus kyi mchod pa bsgrub par shes pas kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that one will also accomplish the desired power by knowing the worship of the occasion,

original: de nas dus kyi mchod pa shes pa sgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas dus kyi mchod pa shes pa sgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, the Tantra of the Knowledge of the Accomplishment of the Worship of the Occasion.

original: drug ldan la sogs pa'i glu'i khyad par gyis rdo rje glu brjod cing gar las byung ba'i dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa mchod pa'i phyag rgya de bzhin du bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: drug ldan la sogs pa'i glu'i khyad par gyis rdo rje glu brjod cing gar las byung ba'i dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa mchod pa'i phyag rgya de bzhin du bcing bar bya'o //
translated: One should bind the seal of worship, such as Vasanta-Vajrī, which arises from the dance, by singing the vajra song with the special song of the six-fold and so forth.

original: de nas dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i snying po brjod cing /
analyzed: de nas dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i snying po brjod cing /
translated: Then, one should recite the essence-mantra of Vasanta-Vajrī and so forth,

original: dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas dor bas /🔽me tog la sogs @184a * //
analyzed: dpyid ka rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgyas dor bas / me tog la sogs @184a * //
translated: and cast the seal of Vasanta-Vajrī and so forth.

original: pa'i rang bzhin gyis mchod pa rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin gyis mchod pa rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the worship of the nature of flowers and so forth.

original: de ltar dus kyi mchod pa bsgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dus kyi mchod pa bsgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the Tantra of the Knowledge of the Accomplishment of the Worship of the Occasion,🔽[the Bhagavān] declares, the Tantra of the Knowledge of the Accomplishment of the Worship of the Occasion.

original: da ni rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi po shes bas kyang dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi po shes bas kyang dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that one also attains power by knowing the four secret offerings of Vajra Weapon and so forth,

original: de nas gsang ba'i mchod pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /🔽rdo rje gar gyi mchod pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can du shes par bya ste bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i mchod pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te / rdo rje gar gyi mchod pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can du shes par bya ste bcas pa'o //
translated: the Tantra of the Secret Offering of Knowledge is taught.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du //
translated: The offering of vajra dance should be known to have the characteristics as explained above.🔽In order,

original: zhes bya ba ni /🔽rdo rje glu len cing sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis kha sbyor gyi thal mo spyi bor bcings te phab la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / rdo rje glu len cing sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis kha sbyor gyi thal mo spyi bor bcings te phab la /
translated: means🔽one should sing the vajra song, bind the añjali gesture of union above one's head as explained above,

original: rdo rje thal mo bcings nas snga ma bzhin du me tog la sogs pa 'bul ba'i tshul gyis te der dor la rdo rje sems dpa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo bcings nas snga ma bzhin du me tog la sogs pa 'bul ba'i tshul gyis te der dor la rdo rje sems dpa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas /
translated: and lower it. Having bound the vajra añjali, one should offer flowers and so forth as explained above. Having cast them there, one should bind the karma mudra of Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcing ba ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcing ba ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa yin no //
translated: The binding of the karma-consorts Vajra Weapon and so forth is expressed by the words “in due order.”

original: bzlas pa'i don gyis ma brjod kyang /
analyzed: bzlas pa'i don gyis ma brjod kyang /
translated: Even though the meaning of repetition is not expressed,

original: mchog gi dngos grub grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub grub par 'gyur //
translated: the supreme attainment is accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba la rdo rje glu'i don gang yin pa dang / rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i snying po'i don gang yin pa de ni bzlas pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rdo rje glu'i don gang yin pa dang / rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i snying po'i don gang yin pa de ni bzlas pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the vajra song and the meaning of the essence of Vajra Weapon and so forth is the meaning of repetition.

original: bzlas pa'i don des rdo rje glu dang rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i snying po ma brjod na yang gsang ba'i mchod pa'i dngos grub kyi rnal 'byor pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i don des rdo rje glu dang rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i snying po ma brjod na yang gsang ba'i mchod pa'i dngos grub kyi rnal 'byor pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the meaning of repetition, the vajra song and the essence of Vajra Weapon and so forth is not expressed, the yogi/nī will accomplish the attainment of secret worship.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni sgrub pa mchog yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'di ni sgrub pa mchog yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because this is the supreme practice.🔽Now, in order to teach “one should not disparage oneself,”

original: / da ni bdag nyid la smad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / da ni bdag nyid la smad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: de nas sdig pa chen po byed pa yang grub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas sdig pa chen po byed pa yang grub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Then, he taught the tantra called Great Sinful One's Knowledge of Attainment.

original: dkyil 'khor la ni ma zhugs kyang //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la ni ma zhugs kyang //
translated: Even one who has not entered the mandala

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor ba gang zhig dkyil 'khor du zhugs par ma gyur pa de yang phyag rgya chen po bcings nas ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed na sdig pa thams cad las rnam par 'gyur na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba gang zhig dkyil 'khor du zhugs par ma gyur pa de yang phyag rgya chen po bcings nas ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed na sdig pa thams cad las rnam par 'gyur na gzhan lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Even a yogin who has not entered the mandala, if he binds the great seal and actualizes meditative concentration, he will be liberated from all sins, so what need is there to mention anyone else?

original: de'i phyir na ngag tshul khrims 'chal ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas @184b rnal 'byor pa bdag nyid la smad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na ngag tshul khrims 'chal ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas @184b rnal 'byor pa bdag nyid la smad par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should not disparage oneself with statements such as, “My speech is immoral,”

original: phyag rgya chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis tshul khrims 'chal ba la sogs pa 'jig pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis tshul khrims 'chal ba la sogs pa 'jig pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the power of the meditative concentration of the great seal destroys immorality and so forth, and because all good qualities such as morality are perfected.

original: byang chub kyi sems la smad pa dang dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la smad pa dang dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One who disparages the thought of awakening will not attain power.

original: de bas na de yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to completely abandon that,

original: de nas dngos grub mi thob pa'i rgyu shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas dngos grub mi thob pa'i rgyu shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: then the tantra called the cause of not attaining power is taught.

original: chags pa ni chos bdag med pa la chags pa dang / sems can smin pa dang grol ba la chags pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni chos bdag med pa la chags pa dang / sems can smin pa dang grol ba la chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment is attachment to the selflessness of phenomena and attachment to the maturation and liberation of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir sems can la chags pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i don smod pa rnal 'byor bas mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can la chags pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i don smod pa rnal 'byor bas mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nī should not disparage the meaning of the statement, “What is the use of attachment to sentient beings?”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par dag ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called “pure.”

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is free from the conceptualization of object and subject,

original: de rnam par dag pa yin no ;
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa yin no ;
translated: it is pure.

original: / de bzhin bde ba ster zhes bya ba la de'i dmigs pa la zhugs pa'i sgrub pa po rnams la chags pa des 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba ster ba yin no //
analyzed: / de bzhin bde ba ster zhes bya ba la de'i dmigs pa la zhugs pa'i sgrub pa po rnams la chags pa des 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba ster ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, it is said to “bestow bliss,” because that attachment bestows mundane and transcendent bliss to the adepts who are engaged in its object.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang chags pa che //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang chags pa che //
translated: The Blessed One is also greatly attached.

original: zhes bya ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po ni chags pa chen po ste smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po ni chags pa chen po ste smad par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the Blessed One, the Great Vajradhara, who is without beginning or end, is greatly attached, and should not be disparaged.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ma dag pas grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ma dag pas grub mi 'gyur //
translated: One will not be accomplished without this.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: chags pa chen po'i rang bzhin can sems can thams cad rjes su chags pa 'di ma dag na ni /
analyzed: chags pa chen po'i rang bzhin can sems can thams cad rjes su chags pa 'di ma dag na ni /
translated: if this attachment, which has the nature of great attachment to all sentient beings, is impure,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri mas gos pas rnal 'byor pa grub par mi 'gyur pa de'i phyir 'di la smad par mi bya ste shin tu gus pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri mas gos pas rnal 'byor pa grub par mi 'gyur pa de'i phyir 'di la smad par mi bya ste shin tu gus pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then the yogi will not be accomplished, because of being covered by the stain of the concepts of subject and object. Therefore, one should not disparage this, but should meditate on it with great respect. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi sems la smod pa dgag par byas nas re zhig rang gi lha'i tshul 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor pa la /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi sems la smod pa dgag par byas nas re zhig rang gi lha'i tshul 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor pa la /
translated: Having thus refuted the disparagement of the thought of awakening, for the yogi who maintains the mode of one's deity,

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i mchog gi dngos grub 'byung ngo zhes bya bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i mchog gi dngos grub 'byung ngo zhes bya bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the supreme powers such as the maṇḍala,

original: de nas dngos grub bsgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /🔽ji bzhin yul ngang ldan gyur nas //
analyzed: de nas dngos grub bsgrub pa shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te / ji bzhin yul ngang ldan gyur nas //
translated: the Tantra of the Knowledge of the Attainment of Powers is taught.

original: zhes bya @185a * //🔽ba la ji ltar dpal rdo rje sems dpa' 'am /🔽rdo rje yid las byung ba la sogs pa'i lha'i khyad par gzhan dag cod pan la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyis yul dang ldan pa de bzhin du rang gi lha'i rgyan rnams kyi rnal 'byor ba yul dang ldan par gyur nas rang gi phyag rgya chen po la
analyzed: zhes bya @185a * // ba la ji ltar dpal rdo rje sems dpa' 'am / rdo rje yid las byung ba la sogs pa'i lha'i khyad par gzhan dag cod pan la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyis yul dang ldan pa de bzhin du rang gi lha'i rgyan rnams kyi rnal 'byor ba yul dang ldan par gyur nas rang gi phyag rgya chen po la
translated: Having become endowed with the field just as it is,🔽one should attain the supreme powers such as the great seal.

original: sogs pa'i mchog gi dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i mchog gi dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as the special deities such as Śrī Vajrasattva or Vajramanonmanī are endowed with the field of the crown protrusion, and so on, in the same way, the yogi/nī becomes endowed with the field of the ornaments of one’s deity and should attain the supreme powers such as the great seal, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir rang gi lha'i tshul 'dzin pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na rtog pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir rang gi lha'i tshul 'dzin pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na rtog pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Why is it that one should attain this by maintaining the mode of one’s deity?

original: gang gi phyir rtog pa thams cad la rang gi lha'i tshul gyis rnal 'byor 'di skye ba 'di nyid la phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pa thams cad la rang gi lha'i tshul gyis rnal 'byor 'di skye ba 'di nyid la phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Since this yoga arises in all conceptualizations by means of one's deity, it is the perfection for yogins and yoginīs who accomplish the great seal and so forth in this very lifetime.

original: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje gsang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje gsang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The great bliss vajra secret

original: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje ni rigs thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje ni rigs thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams te /
translated: The great bliss vajra is the nondual mind and mental factors of all the buddha families.

original: de dag gi gsang ba ni rigs thams cad du gtogs pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gsang ba ni rigs thams cad du gtogs pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Their secret is the nature that is included in all the buddha families.

original: de rnams nyid ni rtogs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid ni rtogs pa chen po'o //
translated: Those are the great conceptualizations.

original: de nyid nam mkha'i khams thams cad la rtag tu bzhugs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje thams cad la khyab pa rnams kyi skyed pa'i rgyu par mtshams med pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir mdzes shing gsal bar gyur pas na rtog pa chen
analyzed: de nyid nam mkha'i khams thams cad la rtag tu bzhugs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje thams cad la khyab pa rnams kyi skyed pa'i rgyu par mtshams med pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir mdzes shing gsal bar gyur pas na rtog pa chen
translated: Since those are the cause that generates all the vajras of the body, speech, and mind of all the buddha families that always abide in all the realms of space, they are the great conceptualizations because they are the cause that generates all the vajras of the body, speech, and mind of all the buddha families that always abide in all the realms of space.

original: po'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: po'i rgyal po'o //
translated: the king of great tantras.

original: de las byung ba'i sgra'i tshogs kyang de ston par byed pa'i phyir rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sgra'i tshogs kyang de ston par byed pa'i phyir rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po'o //
translated: And the collection of words that come from that is also the king of great tantras, because it teaches that.

original: rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po de las rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyud phyi ma zhes bya ba 'di rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rtog pa thams cad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag gi rtog pa thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya
analyzed: rtog pa chen po'i rgyal po de las rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyud phyi ma zhes bya ba 'di rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rtog pa thams cad rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag gi rtog pa thams cad bsdus pa zhes bya
translated: From that king of great tantras, this Tantra of the Subsequent Tantra of All Mandalas is the subsequent tantra called the Compendium of All Mandalas, which is the nature of the root tantra of all the mandalas such as Vajrasattva.

original: ba phyi ma'i rgyud ni phul du byung ba'i rgyud do //
analyzed: ba phyi ma'i rgyud ni phul du byung ba'i rgyud do //
translated: The subsequent tantra is the supreme tantra.

original: de'i cho ga rgyas pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i cho ga rgyas pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The extensive ritual of that is the teaching of the various things to be accomplished and the means of accomplishment.

original: de ltar rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyud phyi ma'i cho ga rgyas pa mchog gi dngos grub bsgrub par byed pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa thams cad kyi rgyud phyi ma'i cho ga rgyas pa mchog gi dngos grub bsgrub par byed pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the extensive ritual of the subsequent tantra of all mandalas, which accomplishes the supreme attainment,🔽now, in order to teach the extensive ritual of the root tantra, which accomplishes the common attainments, it is said:

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i lha @185b mo'i dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par bsgrub pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i lha @185b mo'i dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par bsgrub pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Now, beginning with “the Blessed One, the eternal,” he teaches the special result that is taught in the maṇḍala of the goddess of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de nas bcom ldan rdo rje 'chang chen pos rdo rje bsgrub pa'i rgyud gsungs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan rdo rje 'chang chen pos rdo rje bsgrub pa'i rgyud gsungs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “Then the Blessed One, the great Vajradhara, taught the Vajra Tantra” is to be supplied.

original: de nas kyi sgra ni skabs la bab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni skabs la bab pa'o //
translated: The word “then” is used in the sense of sequence.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: “The Blessed One” has been explained.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang de'i rgyu mthun par de ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis rtag tu bzhugs pa rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang de'i rgyu mthun par de ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis rtag tu bzhugs pa rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: “The eternal” is Vajrasattva, who is always present by nature as the cause of the dharmadhātu, which is without beginning or end.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin can rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin can bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin can rdo rje 'chang chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin can bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that the great Vajradhara has the nature of the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva and that the teacher has the nature of the maṇḍala of the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje gsang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje gsang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Vajra of All the Tathagatas, Secret,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la gsang ba yang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la gsang ba yang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
translated: is so called because it is the vajra of all the tathagatas, who are both tathagatas and secret.

original: de rnams kyi rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje khro bo'i phyag na gnas pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' dang / rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje khro bo'i phyag na gnas pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra of those is the Blessed Vajrasattva, and the blazing vajra held in the hand of the wrathful Vajra of Excitement.

original: de las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rab tu dga' pa'i rdo rje khro bo'i rigs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rab tu dga' pa'i rdo rje khro bo'i rigs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ste rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The Blessed Vajra of Excitement, the wrathful one, who arises from that, is also the vajra of all the tathagatas, that is, the Great Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur pa ni nor bu'i rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur pa ni nor bu'i rigs te /
translated: The consecration of all the tathagatas is the jewel lineage.

original: de nyid mi phyed pas na 'di'i rdo rje rin po che ste /
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pas na 'di'i rdo rje rin po che ste /
translated: Since that is indivisible, it is his vajra jewel.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur pa'i rdo rje rin po che ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur pa'i rdo rje rin po che ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o//
translated: The vajra jewel of the consecration of all the tathagatas is the Great Vajradhara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / padma'i rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / padma'i rigs te /
translated: The Dharma of all the Tathagatas is the nature of the perfection of wisdom, the mind and mental factors, and the lotus family.🔽The vision of that is the discernment of all phenomena as naturally delightful.🔽The knowledge of that is the certainty.

original: de las gzigs pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i zhes bya bar so sor rtog ba'i der shes pa ni nges pa ste des dbang phyug ni rang dbang ste dngos por 'dzin pa'i zhen pa ni gzhan dbang dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzigs pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i zhes bya bar so sor rtog ba'i der shes pa ni nges pa ste des dbang phyug ni rang dbang ste dngos por 'dzin pa'i zhen pa ni gzhan dbang dang bral ba'o //
translated: The lordship by that is the independence, free from the clinging to substantiality.

original: ye shes kyi dbang phyug nyid mi phyed pa'i padma 'di la yod pas na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos gzigs pa'i @186a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dbang phyug nyid mi phyed pa'i padma 'di la yod pas na / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos gzigs pa'i @186a * //
translated: Since this lotus is the lordship of knowledge,

original: ye shes kyi dbang phyug gi rdo rje'i padma'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dbang phyug gi rdo rje'i padma'o //
translated: it is the lotus of the vajra lordship of the knowledge of the vision of the Dharma of all the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mdzad pa'o //
translated: The diversity of all the Tathagatas is the nature of the various kinds of worship of the Buddhas, and the activity of benefiting sentient beings.

original: mdzad pas na mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: mdzad pas na mdzad pa ste /
translated: The performance of that is the performance.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzad pa mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzad pa mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: The performance of the deeds of all the Tathagatas is the performance of the deeds of all the Tathagatas.

original: de'i dngos po ni mdzad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni mdzad pa nyid do //
translated: The state of that is the performance itself.🔽The extensive rite of the performance of the benefit of sentient beings by the emanations of the Buddhas is the extensive rite of the performance of the benefit of sentient beings by the emanations of the Buddhas.🔽The vajra of the unbroken continuity of the practice of the object of practice and the practitioner is the vajra of the unbroken continuity of the practice of the object of practice and the practitioner.

original: des phrin las dam pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas sems can gyi don mdzad ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi cho ga rgyas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i rgyun rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i rdo rje 'chang ga la yod pa de la de skad
analyzed: des phrin las dam pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas sems can gyi don mdzad ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi cho ga rgyas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i rgyun rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i rdo rje 'chang ga la yod pa de la de skad
translated: Where that exists, there is the extensive rite of the performance of the benefit of sentient beings by the emanations of the Buddhas.

original: ces bya'o // yon tan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen pos ci mdzad nas rgyud de gsungs she na /
analyzed: ces bya'o // yon tan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen pos ci mdzad nas rgyud de gsungs she na /
translated: Having the suchness of the qualities, what did the Great Vajradhara do, and why did he teach that tantra?

original: thams cad khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thams cad khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: All-pervading, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor la thams cad la khyab pa de mdzad par shes par mdzad nas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor la thams cad la khyab pa de mdzad par shes par mdzad nas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Having done that which is all-pervading to the retinue of the Tathagatas, he caused them to understand, etc.

original: thams cad la khyab pa ni kun du khyab pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la khyab pa ni kun du khyab pa'o //
translated: All-pervading is all-pervading.

original: de nyid kyi khyab pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyab pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that pervasion,

original: ma lus shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sgra'i don bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma lus shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sgra'i don bshad zin to //
translated: he said, without exception, etc. The meaning of the words without exception has been explained.

original: rigs thams cad kyi lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje khams te /
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje khams te /
translated: The deities of all the families are the vajra-elements of body, speech, and mind.

original: de dag gi bstan pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i dngos grub ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bstan pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i dngos grub ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Their teaching is the attainment of fearlessness, which is complete in the continuums of all sentient beings.

original: de'i cho ga rgyas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: de'i cho ga rgyas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i tshogs te /
translated: Its extensive ritual is the assembly of the established and the establishing.

original: de spro ba ni phyogs bcu khyab pa'i 'khor lo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o /
analyzed: de spro ba ni phyogs bcu khyab pa'i 'khor lo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o /
translated: The one who expands that is the one who has the wheel that pervades the ten directions.

original: de tshad ci dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: de tshad ci dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of that?

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the wheel that reaches to the end of the realm of space.

original: rdzas thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: rdzas thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni nam mkha' ste /
translated: The nature of the non-existence of all substances is space.

original: de nyid mthar thug pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo gang la yod pa de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de nyid mthar thug pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo gang la yod pa de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: The one who has the wheel that reaches to the end of that is the wheel that reaches to the end of the realm of space.

original: nam mkha' thams cad khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha' thams cad khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it pervades all space.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni de @186b bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni de @186b bzhin nyid de /
translated: The dharmadhatu is suchness.

original: de khyad par med pas na chos kyi dbyings rnam par spro ba'o //
analyzed: de khyad par med pas na chos kyi dbyings rnam par spro ba'o //
translated: Since that is without distinctions, it is the expansion of the dharmadhatu.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab rnams te khams thams cad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab rnams te khams thams cad de /
translated: All the atoms of all worlds are all realms.

original: der kun du 'gro ba gang la yod pa ni khams kun du 'gro ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: der kun du 'gro ba gang la yod pa ni khams kun du 'gro ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: The wheel of all the transcendent ones that pervades all realms exists there.🔽

original: rigs thams cad kyi rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
translated: There, the wheel of all the Tathagatas who go everywhere is the universal wheel, which is the mandala of the support and the supported of all the clans.

original: de mngon par shes par mdzad pa ni gdul bya rnams kyis rtogs par mdzad nas so //🔽'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'i dang po'i snying po'i yi ge h'um ste /🔽de'i gsang pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje sgrub pa'i rgyud gang yin pa de /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no //🔽mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i des ci zhig bya zhe na /🔽ji srid 'khor pa'i gnas la bzhugs //
analyzed: de mngon par shes par mdzad pa ni gdul bya rnams kyis rtogs par mdzad nas so // 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'i dang po'i snying po'i yi ge h'um ste / de'i gsang pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje sgrub pa'i rgyud gang yin pa de / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don gyi phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no // mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i des ci zhig bya zhe na / ji srid 'khor pa'i gnas la bzhugs //
translated: Having manifested that, having caused the disciples to realize it,
