translated: Great joy is so called because he possesses this joy, the essence of vajra mindfulness and vajra mindfulness woman.

original: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ni 'di la kun nas bzang ba mnga' bas te sangs rgyas nyid dam byang chub sems dpa' nyid 'di las 'byung bas na kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po zhes bya ba ni 'di la kun nas bzang ba mnga' bas te sangs rgyas nyid dam byang chub sems dpa' nyid 'di las 'byung bas na kun du bzang po'o //
translated: Samantabhadra is so called because he possesses the all-good, that is, because buddhahood or the state of a bodhisattva arises from him.

original: rdo rje snyems pa ni rdo rje snyems pa'i cha lugs 'chang ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //🔽kun bdag nyid ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa lha mo thams cad @219a * //

original: kyi tshul 'dzin pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: kyi tshul 'dzin pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The all-nature is the great Vajradhara who assumes the guise of all goddesses such as Lochanā and so on.

original: don 'di nyid ni 'di'i 'og nas /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni 'di'i 'og nas /
translated: This very meaning is explained below:

original: shin tu dag pa kun gyi mchog //
analyzed: shin tu dag pa kun gyi mchog //

original: gdod nas grol ba de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: gdod nas grol ba de bzhin gshegs //
translated: the primordial liberation is the Tathagata,

original: kun du bzang po kun bdag nyid //
analyzed: kun du bzang po kun bdag nyid //

original: byang chub sems dpa' go cha mchog / ces bya ba bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' go cha mchog / ces bya ba bshad pa yin no ;

original: / rdo rje snyems tshul bdag po ni //
analyzed: / rdo rje snyems tshul bdag po ni //
translated: The lord of the vajra dance

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po dang / lha mo rdo rje snyems ma ni rdo rje snyems tshul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po dang / lha mo rdo rje snyems ma ni rdo rje snyems tshul zhes bya'o //
translated: The great seal of Vajrasattva and the goddess Vajradhṛk are called the vajra dance.

original: de'i bdag po yin pas na rdo rje snyems ma bdag po ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag po yin pas na rdo rje snyems ma bdag po ste /

original: chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang chen po ni gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa ni rdo rje snyems tshul yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The dharmadhatu, whose nature is beginningless and endless, is the great Vajradhara, because the vajra dance is the natural outflow of the gnosis of nonduality.

original: de yang thugs ni bcom ldan 'das 'dod chags chen po dang 'di'i lha mo zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: de yang thugs ni bcom ldan 'das 'dod chags chen po dang 'di'i lha mo zhes gsungs pas /

analyzed: dngos grub chen po kun gyi mchog ;

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni dge ba'i khams bsags pa yin pas na sems zhes bya'o //

analyzed: 'di rtogs par bya ba'i phyir man ngag gsungs pa ni sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i sems de nyid rang bzhin gyis dag par rtog pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis bskyod par mi nus

translated: Because it is the supreme of all meditative stabilizations, in the manner of a one-pointed mind in the aspect of suchness.🔽The vajra is the nature of the meditative stabilization of the objective selflessness of dharmas. That mind is free from all discursive thought.🔽🔽Therefore, it is called the supreme meditative stabilization vajra.🔽From the definite, the vajra.🔽

translated: The Bhagavat is Ratnasambhava together with his family.

original: sangs rgyas nyid skyes zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub bdag nyid las 'khrungs pas na sangs rgyas nyid skyes te gzugs thams cad ston pa'i ye shes kyi sems can thams cad gdul bya'i spyod pa'i mchog mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid skyes zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub bdag nyid las 'khrungs pas na sangs rgyas nyid skyes te gzugs thams cad ston pa'i ye shes kyi sems can thams cad gdul bya'i spyod pa'i mchog mnga' ba ste /
translated: The birth of buddhahood is the birth of the enlightenment of the buddhas from the self, and so is the birth of buddhahood.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa'o //

original: mchog skyes pa zhes bya ba ni mchog las skyes pas na mchog las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: mchog skyes pa zhes bya ba ni mchog las skyes pas na mchog las skyes pa ste /
translated: Supremely born means born from the supreme, from the supreme nature of the perfection of effort, the door of liberation of natural luminosity.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mchog de las 'khrungs pa don yod par grub pa'i rigs dang bcas pa'i ngo bo'o //

translated: It is the essence of the family of Amoghasiddhi, born from that supreme nature.

original: de yang ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang sangs rgyas yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang sangs rgyas yin zhe na /

original: rang sems so sor rtogs pa @220b las ;

original: / byang chub sems mchog rdo rje nyid //

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: au tishtha sa ma ya kro dha /
analyzed: au tishtha sa ma ya kro dha /

analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad du sprul pa'i snying po yin la /

analyzed: sprul pa yang khro bo yin par bshad do //

analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug ces bya ba ni /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sngar gsungs pa yin te mtshan 'di ni padma rigs kyi sgo nas brjod pa yin no //

original: de yang / dngos grub kun la rjes chags pas //
analyzed: de yang / dngos grub kun la rjes chags pas //
translated: Moreover,

original: 'dod chags chen po bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po bcom ldan 'das //
translated: the Bhagavān is great passion,🔽passion for all powers.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i dpal rgyal 'di //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i dpal rgyal 'di //
translated: This is the glorious Victor,

original: dmar zhing sna tshogs 'od 'bar ba //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dmar zhing sna tshogs 'od 'bar ba // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: red, blazing with various lights.

original: bde chen nyid ces bya ba ni bde ba yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: bde chen nyid ces bya ba ni bde ba yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na bde ba chen po ste /
translated: Great bliss is bliss and also great, thus it is great bliss.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyang zag pa med cing thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba ni bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyang zag pa med cing thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba ni bde ba chen po ste /
translated: The buddhas’ immaculate bliss and mental bliss that is beginningless and endless is great bliss.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na bde chen nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na bde chen nyid do //
translated: Since it is the essence of that, it is great bliss.

original: 'di nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni /
translated: This is explained below:

original: dngos grub kun gyi mi 'gyur bde //
analyzed: dngos grub kun gyi mi 'gyur bde //
translated: The unchanging bliss of all powers

original: bde ba chen po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bshad do //
translated: is explained as great bliss.

original: zhes 'og nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained below.🔽Desire is that which is desired,

original: 'dod dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod par bya ba nyid yin pas na 'dod pa ste /🔽mngon par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod par bya ba nyid yin pas na 'dod pa ste /🔽mngon par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that which is wished for.

original: de yang byang chub kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: de yang byang chub kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' dang / byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan no //
translated: Moreover, Vajrasattva, who has the characteristic of enlightenment, and the cultivation of the thought of enlightenment, are the objects of desire.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i bde ba chen po de'i ngo bo nyid gyur pa dang mthar thug pa'o //🔽de yang ji ltar bcom @221a * //
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad pa'i bde ba chen po de'i ngo bo nyid gyur pa dang mthar thug pa'o // de yang ji ltar bcom @221a * //
translated: Liberation is the nature and the culmination of that great bliss as it has been explained.

original: ldan 'das 'dod pa dang thar ba yin zhe na /🔽dngos grub kun la rjes chags pas //
analyzed: ldan 'das 'dod pa dang thar ba yin zhe na / dngos grub kun la rjes chags pas //
translated: And how is the Blessed One desire and liberation?

original: 'dod chags chen po bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po bcom ldan 'das //
translated: He is the Blessed One, great passion,

original: dngos grub kun gyi mi 'gyur bde //
analyzed: dngos grub kun gyi mi 'gyur bde //
translated: because of his passion for all powers.

original: bde ba chen po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bshad do //
translated: He is great bliss,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: explained as the unchanging bliss of all powers.

original: nor che ba zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes kyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin pas na nor che ba'o //
analyzed: nor che ba zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes kyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin pas na nor che ba'o //
translated: He is the great wealth, because he is the source of all mundane and supramundane jewels, the gnosis equal to space.

original: dus gsum zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo yin pas na dus gsum mo //
analyzed: dus gsum zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo yin pas na dus gsum mo //
translated: The three times are the three times of the mind and mental factors of the past, future, and present.

original: srid gsum zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa ni srid pa gsum mo //
analyzed: srid gsum zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa ni srid pa gsum mo //
translated: The three existences are the three existences of the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.🔽Since the three worlds are also limitless, the three existences are taught to be the three worlds.

original: de yang mtha' yas pa na 'jig rten gsum 'dul pas srid gsum yin no zhes gsungs pa yin pas srid pa gsum gyis 'dul ba rnams kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das srid pa gsum gyi ngo bor ston cing bzhugs pas na srid pa gsum zhes bshad pa yin no
analyzed: de yang mtha' yas pa na 'jig rten gsum 'dul pas srid gsum yin no zhes gsungs pa yin pas srid pa gsum gyis 'dul ba rnams kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das srid pa gsum gyi ngo bor ston cing bzhugs pas na srid pa gsum zhes bshad pa yin no
translated: Therefore, since the Bhagavān abides teaching the nature of the three existences for the sake of those to be tamed by the three existences, it is explained as the three existences.

original: // mtshan gsum po de dag gis kyang dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs su ston par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: // mtshan gsum po de dag gis kyang dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs su ston par shes pa yin no //
translated: It should be understood that those three names also indicate the family of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: mchog gsum zhes bya ba ni rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa la mchog gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog gsum zhes bya ba ni rgyal bar byed pa dang / sbrang rtsir byed pa dang / don thams cad grub par byed pa la mchog gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: The three supreme ones are called supreme because they cause victory, cause the attainment of honey, and cause the accomplishment of all aims.

original: 'jig rten gsum mchog ces bya ba ni de rnams kyi ming gi khyad par la 'jig rten gsum zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum mchog ces bya ba ni de rnams kyi ming gi khyad par la 'jig rten gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: The three worlds are called the three worlds because they are the particular names of those three.

original: 'jig rten mchog gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten mchog gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said to be the blessing of the three supreme ones of the world.

original: khams gsum pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su sprul pas na khams gsum pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: khams gsum pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su sprul pas na khams gsum pa zhes bya'o /
translated: The three realms are called the three realms because they are emanations in the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: brtan dang zhes bya ba ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab la sogs pa dngos po thams cad 'byung ba'i tshul gyis gnas pas na brtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtan dang zhes bya ba ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab la sogs pa dngos po thams cad 'byung ba'i tshul gyis gnas pas na brtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The firm are called firm because they abide in the manner of giving rise to all things, such as Mount Meru, the king of mountains.

original: de yang / sems can bsod nams cher mthong bas //
analyzed: de yang / sems can bsod nams cher mthong bas //
translated: And that is explained below:

original: brtan pa kun nyid nga yin no //
analyzed: brtan pa kun nyid nga yin no //
translated: I am the firm, all-pervading,

original: zhes 'og nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: seen by beings of great merit.

original: rang 'byung zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa dngos po thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pas na rang 'byung ba ste chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa dngos po thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pas na rang 'byung ba ste chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: Self-arisen means that the dharmadhatu is the cause of the arising of all things, such as perfect buddhahood, and so is self-arisen.

original: @221b gsal zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi so sor rang gis rig pa'i ngo bo chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: @221b gsal zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi so sor rang gis rig pa'i ngo bo chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Clear means the dharmadhatu, the essence of the individual self-cognizance of all.

original: phra rab ces bya ba ni shin tu phra bas na shin tu phra ba ste chos kyi dbyings de nyid do //
analyzed: phra rab ces bya ba ni shin tu phra bas na shin tu phra ba ste chos kyi dbyings de nyid do //
translated: Subtle means the dharmadhatu itself, since it is extremely subtle.

original: sbom pa dang zhes bya ba ni sku phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa nam mkha' khyab pas na sbom pa'o //
analyzed: sbom pa dang zhes bya ba ni sku phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa nam mkha' khyab pas na sbom pa'o //
translated: Coarse means the great seal of the body and so forth, which are coarse because they pervade space.

original: bsags pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnams bsags shing bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: bsags pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnams bsags shing bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
translated: Accumulated means the essence of the accumulation and collection of the families of the tathagatas and so forth.

original: rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni mngal nas skyes pa dang / sgo nga las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa ste rang gi las kyi stobs las skyes pa ni rgyu ba zhes bya ba ste sems can sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni mngal nas skyes pa dang / sgo nga las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa ste rang gi las kyi stobs las skyes pa ni rgyu ba zhes bya ba ste sems can sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Moving” means born from a womb, born from an egg, born from heat and moisture, and born miraculously. Born from one’s own karma, it is called “moving,” and is a sentient being with a mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang chos nyid la dgongs nas de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang chos nyid la dgongs nas de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The Bhagavat, intending the reality, said that because of its nature, it is so.

original: de yang sems kyi 'du byed pas rgyu ba zhes 'og nas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sems kyi 'du byed pas rgyu ba zhes 'og nas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is explained later as “moving” because of the mental formation.

original: rab mchog ces bya ba ni phul du byung ba ste /
analyzed: rab mchog ces bya ba ni phul du byung ba ste /
translated: “Supreme” means excellent.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs rab mchog gis 'dul ba rnams la de'i gzugs su ston par mdzad pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs rab mchog gis 'dul ba rnams la de'i gzugs su ston par mdzad pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is so called because it shows itself in the form of a universal monarch, etc., for the sake of those to be trained by the excellent form.

original: thob mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa rnams la de mngon sum du gyur par mdzad pas na thob pa'o //
analyzed: thob mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa rnams la de mngon sum du gyur par mdzad pas na thob pa'o //
translated: The attainer is the one who has attained the realization of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: srid pa zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa thob par mdzad pa des mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du srid pa shin tu grub par ni srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa thob par mdzad pa des mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid du srid pa shin tu grub par ni srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The existence is the existence of the non-abiding nirvana, which is attained by the one who has attained the glory of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni de 'dul ba'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir 'gro ba rigs drug gi mtshan gyis bzhugs par mdzad pa dang chos nyid kyi tshul gyis 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni de 'dul ba'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir 'gro ba rigs drug gi mtshan gyis bzhugs par mdzad pa dang chos nyid kyi tshul gyis 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The samsara is the dwelling in the form of the six classes of migrating beings in order to care for those sentient beings who are to be tamed by that, and it is called samsara by the way of reality.

original: sbyong mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad sbyong bar mdzad pas na sbyong mdzad ba'o //
analyzed: sbyong mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad sbyong bar mdzad pas na sbyong mdzad ba'o //
translated: The purifier is the one who purifies all sentient beings by the way of the buddhas and so forth.

original: thog mtha' med pa zhes bya ba dang po'i thog ma ste skye ba'o //
analyzed: thog mtha' med pa zhes bya ba dang po'i thog ma ste skye ba'o //
translated: The beginningless and endless is the beginning, which is birth.🔽 The end is the end, which is death.

original: tha ma ni dus tshig nges pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni dus tshig nges pa med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The last is the nirvāṇa without a fixed time.

original: gang la thog ma dang tham cad pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tham cad pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
translated: That which has no beginning and no end is without beginning and end.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang zhin no /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang zhin no /
translated: It is the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: thog ma tham can zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi @222a * //
analyzed: thog ma tham can zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kyi @222a * //
translated: That which has a beginning and an end is the dharmadhātu.🔽It is the body of Vajrasattva arisen from the natural outflow of the dharmadhātu.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa'i sku nas brtsams te /

original: po'o // gdug ba'i mchog ces bya ba ni sems can thams cad la nye bar 'tshe zhing gnod par bye dpa'i sems dang ldan pa ni gdug pa'i yid ces bya ste /
analyzed: po'o // gdug ba'i mchog ces bya ba ni sems can thams cad la nye bar 'tshe zhing gnod par bye dpa'i sems dang ldan pa ni gdug pa'i yid ces bya ste /
translated: The most violent is the one who has a mind that is violent, that is, who has a mind that injures and harms all sentient beings.

original: de rnams la 'jigs ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir shin tu gdug pa ston pas na gdug pa'i mchog ste /
analyzed: de rnams la 'jigs ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir shin tu gdug pa ston pas na gdug pa'i mchog ste /
translated: He is the most violent because he displays the most violent in order to generate fear in them.

original: gdug pa rnams las kyang gdug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams las kyang gdug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is the most violent of the violent, that is, the most violent of the violent.

original: drag po zhes bya ba ni gdug pa de rnams nyid gdul bar bya ba'i phyir rdo rje drag po'i skur ston pas na drag po'o //
analyzed: drag po zhes bya ba ni gdug pa de rnams nyid gdul bar bya ba'i phyir rdo rje drag po'i skur ston pas na drag po'o //
translated: He is fierce because he displays the fierce body of Vajrapani in order to tame those very violent ones.

original: drag po nyid ces bya ba ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs sprul nas drag po thams cad za bar mdzad pas na drag po nyid do //
analyzed: drag po nyid ces bya ba ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs sprul nas drag po thams cad za bar mdzad pas na drag po nyid do //
translated: “Wrathful” means that, having emanated the assembly of Vajraḍākas, he devours all wrathful ones.

original: za mdzad ces bya ba ni khro bo stobs po ches gdug pa'i tshogs rnams za bar mdzad pas na za mdzad do //
analyzed: za mdzad ces bya ba ni khro bo stobs po ches gdug pa'i tshogs rnams za bar mdzad pas na za mdzad do //
translated: “Devourer” means that, having emanated the assembly of Vajraḍākas, he devours the assembly of evil ones.

original: mtshan dgu po 'di dag ni rdo rje rigs kyi gsang ba'i ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstod pa yin no /
analyzed: mtshan dgu po 'di dag ni rdo rje rigs kyi gsang ba'i ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstod pa yin no /
translated: These nine names are the praise from the perspective of the maṇḍala of the secret painting of the Vajra family.

original: thams cad dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “All pure” means the nature of the great seal.

original: padma chen po zhes bya ba ni padma'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: padma chen po zhes bya ba ni padma'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: “Great lotus” means the pledge seal of the lotus.

original: shes rab thabs dang zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis bskyed pa'i thabs ni shes rab thabs te /
analyzed: shes rab thabs dang zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis bskyed pa'i thabs ni shes rab thabs te /
translated: “Wisdom and means” means the means generated by wisdom is wisdom and means.

original: sems can thams cad 'dul pa'i phyir khro gnyer can la sogs pa lha mo'i tshogs kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sku'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'dul pa'i phyir khro gnyer can la sogs pa lha mo'i tshogs kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sku'o //
translated: The form of Lokeśvara residing in the midst of the assembly of goddesses such as Bhṛkuṭī is for the purpose of subduing all sentient beings.

original: tshul chen zhes bya ba ni gzugs thams cad kun du ston pas sems can gyi khams cad rnams par sbyong bar mdzad pas na tshul chen po'o //
analyzed: tshul chen zhes bya ba ni gzugs thams cad kun du ston pas sems can gyi khams cad rnams par sbyong bar mdzad pas na tshul chen po'o //
translated: The “great way” is the great way because it purifies the entire realm of sentient beings by displaying all forms.

original: 'dod chags dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The purity of passion” is as follows.

original: ji ltar padma dmar po 'di //
analyzed: ji ltar padma dmar po 'di //
translated: Just as this red lotus

original: tshon gyi nyes pas mi gos pa //
analyzed: tshon gyi nyes pas mi gos pa //
translated: is not soiled by the faults of the mud,

original: de bzhin dag pa'i khams gsum pa //
analyzed: de bzhin dag pa'i khams gsum pa //
translated: so the pure three realms

original: gnas kyi nyes pas mi gos so //
analyzed: gnas kyi nyes pas mi gos so //
translated: are not soiled by the faults of the abodes.

original: zhes bya ba ni padma 'dab ma phyed pa'i rnal 'byor rdo rje chos kyi bsgom pas 'dod chags dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padma 'dab ma phyed pa'i rnal 'byor rdo rje chos kyi bsgom pas 'dod chags dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of passion through the yoga of the half-lotus posture and the meditation of Vajradharma.

original: ting nge 'dzin mchog ces bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes @224a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mchog ces bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o zhes @224a * //
translated: “The supreme meditative absorption” is the one-pointed mind that thinks, “All phenomena are pure by nature.”

original: bya bar sems rtse gcig ba gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin mchog ste dam pa'o //
analyzed: bya bar sems rtse gcig ba gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin mchog ste dam pa'o //
translated: That is the supreme, the best, meditative absorption.

original: sna tshogs chags pa zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs chag spa ste sems can thams cad 'dul ba la zhe na pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs chags pa zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs chag spa ste sems can thams cad 'dul ba la zhe na pa'o //
translated: “The various passions” are the various passions, the desire to tame all sentient beings.

original: dbang phyug che zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug chen pos 'dul pa rnams la de'i gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug che zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug chen pos 'dul pa rnams la de'i gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: The one called Maheśvara is Maheśvara, because he takes on the form of that [Maheśvara] in order to tame those to be tamed by Maheśvara.

original: mtshan brgyad po 'di dag ni padma'i rigs kyi ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstod pa'o /🔽nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan brgyad po 'di dag ni padma'i rigs kyi ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstod pa'o / nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These eight epithets are praises from the perspective of the maṇḍala of the lotus family's painting.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes mnga' bas na nam mkha'o //🔽mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang nye bar ye shes rgyu mthun pa las byung bar gyur pa'i rin po che'i rigs kyi ngo bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje na mkha'i khams thams cad na rtag tu bzhugs pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ye shes mnga' bas na nam mkha'o // mtha' yas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang nye bar ye shes rgyu mthun pa las byung bar gyur pa'i rin po che'i rigs kyi ngo bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje na mkha'i khams thams cad na rtag tu bzhugs pa la /
translated: The one called ākāśa is ākāśa, because he possesses the wisdom that is equal to space.

original: mtha' yas pa'i sgrar bshad do //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i sgrar bshad do //
translated: The one called ananta is explained as the word ananta, which is the body, speech, and mind vajra that is the nature of the jewel family, which always abides in all the realms of space, arisen from the cause of wisdom that is similar to space.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi 'gyur ba ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi 'gyur ba ni rtag pa'o //
translated: The one called nitya is nitya, because permanence and immutability are eternal.

original: don zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer bas na don te /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer bas na don te /
translated: The one called artha is artha, because it is sought for the sake of the goal.

original: sems can rnams kyi don du gnyer ba yin no zhes ston pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don du gnyer ba yin no zhes ston pa yin te /
translated: It shows that for the sake of sentient beings is the aim.

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' mdzod kyi ngo bo nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' mdzod kyi ngo bo nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching on the nature of the Blessed One's sky treasury.

original: 'byung bo thams cad ces bya ba ni 'byung bas na 'byung bo ste /
analyzed: 'byung bo thams cad ces bya ba ni 'byung bas na 'byung bo ste /
translated: As for all beings, a being is one who comes into existence.

original: sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the nature of sentient and non-sentient beings.

original: gnas chen po zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' thams cad la gnas pa'i dang po'i gzhal yas khang gi ngo bo nyid du gyu bas na gnas chen po'o //
analyzed: gnas chen po zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' thams cad la gnas pa'i dang po'i gzhal yas khang gi ngo bo nyid du gyu bas na gnas chen po'o //
translated: As for great abode, it is a great abode because it is the nature of the first celestial mansion that abides in all of space.

original: 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i lha'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i lha'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: As for prosperity, it is the nature of the deities of consecration.

original: dpal zhes bya ba ni gter gyi lha mo'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dpal zhes bya ba ni gter gyi lha mo'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: As for glory, it is the nature of the treasure goddesses.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan mchog gi lha mo'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas thams cad du spod ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan mchog gi lha mo'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas thams cad du spod ba'o //
translated: As for chief, it is the nature of the victory banner goddesses, and so it is exalted above all.

original: rgyal zhes bya ba ni lha mo chen mo'i bdag por gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mdzes shing gsal bas na rgyal po'o //
analyzed: rgyal zhes bya ba ni lha mo chen mo'i bdag por gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mdzes shing gsal bas na rgyal po'o //
translated: The word king means that he is a king because he is beautiful and radiant with the nature of being the lord of the great goddess.

original: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa //
translated: The one who fulfills all wishes

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub stsol bas na thams cad rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub stsol bas na thams cad rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: means that he is the fulfiller of all wishes because he grants the siddhis that are ardently desired by all sentient beings through the nature of consecration and so forth.

original: mtshan bcu gcig po 'di dag ni rin po che'i rigs kyi @224b ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan bcu gcig po 'di dag ni rin po che'i rigs kyi @224b ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstod pa yin no //
translated: These eleven epithets are the praise from the perspective of the maṇḍala of the precious family's painting.

original: phyag 'tshal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you, I pay homage!

original: phyag 'tshal 'dud cing phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal 'dud cing phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage, bowing down, I pay homage!

original: zhes bya ba yang du phyag 'tshal 'dud pa ni lhag par gus pa'i khyad pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang du phyag 'tshal 'dud pa ni lhag par gus pa'i khyad pa ston pa yin no //
translated: The repetition of homage, bowing down shows the special devotion.

original: dad pas khyed la bdag brten bgyid ;
analyzed: dad pas khyed la bdag brten bgyid ;
translated: With faith, I rely on you.

original: / ces bya ba ni khyed mngon sum du bya ste zhes bya ba ni rtag pa kho nar bsgom par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / ces bya ba ni khyed mngon sum du bya ste zhes bya ba ni rtag pa kho nar bsgom par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is you should make it manifest means you should cultivate it constantly, is the meaning.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du ro gcig pa ste /
translated: Vajrasattva means one taste in the same way.🔽And that is explained below:🔽Without beginning or end, permanent,

original: de yang / thog ma tham ma med cing rtag / mi zad mnyam pa med mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang / thog ma tham ma med cing rtag / mi zad mnyam pa med mi 'gyur //
translated: inexhaustible, incomparable, unchanging,

original: sems dpa' rdo rje che rang bzhin //
analyzed: sems dpa' rdo rje che rang bzhin //
translated: the nature of the great being vajra,

original: sems dpa' rdo rje zhes bshad do //🔽zhes 'og nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' rdo rje zhes bshad do // zhes 'og nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: is explained as the being vajra.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i dus ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa bzhugs pa yin pas na dang po'i zhes sngar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i dus ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa bzhugs pa yin pas na dang po'i zhes sngar bshad pa yin no //
translated: And first means present, because it exists as permanent by nature. Therefore, it was explained earlier as first.

original: mtshan gnyis po 'di ni thams cad du dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis po 'di ni thams cad du dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: These two epithets show that everywhere it is the nature of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: bdag grub mdzad do zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag grub mdzad do zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: Make me accomplished means the master's request.

original: da ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa'i phan yon gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod pa'i phan yon gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Now, beginning with “Whoever recites the praise with the one hundred and eight names,” he teaches the benefits of the praise.

original: nyin re zhes bya ba ni re re zhing ngo ;
analyzed: nyin re zhes bya ba ni re re zhing ngo ;
translated: “Every day” means each day.

original: / nang bar zhes bya ba ni snga dro'i thun tshigs dang po ste /
analyzed: / nang bar zhes bya ba ni snga dro'i thun tshigs dang po ste /
translated: “Morning” is the first part of the morning.
